location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 24 of 1866 from Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bombay to Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the situation in Gwadar,and that although having a Vessel of War cruizing the Gulf would be most advisable and would support the Political Assistant at the Gwadar station Pelly supposes that one is most likely not available and suggests that this leaves them with the options to either withdraw or to go on as usual showing a 'calm and confident front'.The Government reply No. 66 of 1866 to this letter can be found on folio 61.
